arm_group.description: development of AKI by sCr and by novel biomarkers

brief_summary.textblock:
Acute kidney injury (AKI), is a common complication of patients undergoing liver
      transplantation. Timing and definition of AKI, usually based on serum creatinine, have been
      inaccurate and inconsistent.

      The aim of the study is to compare the timing for diagnosis of AKI, comparing novel
      biomarkers and serum creatinine. In addition, we aim to evaluate if the pattern of elevation
      of the novel biomarkers provide information on progression and severity of AKI.

clinical_study.brief_title: Acute Kidney Injury Biomarkers: Diagnosis and Application in Pre-operative Period of Liver Transplantation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Older  than 18 years

          -  Reception liver transplantation

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  CKD stage 4 / 5

          -  Combined organ transplants

          -  Patients receiving dialysis before liver transplant operation

clinical_study.official_title: Acute Kidney Injury Biomarkers: Diagnosis and Application in Pre-operative Period of Liver Transplantation

overall_official.affiliation: Faculty of Medicine, University of São paulo

oversight_info.authority: Brazil:  Comissão Nacional de Ética em Pesquisa

primary_outcome.description: Compare the timing for diagnosis of AKI comparing novel biomarkers and serum creatinine defined by Kidney Disease Improving Global Outcomes. In addition, we aim to evaluate if the pattern of elevation of the novel biomarkers provide information on progression and severity of AKI.
primary_outcome.measure: Development of Acute Kidney Injury based on novel biomarkers

Nejat M, Pickering JW, Devarajan P, Bonventre JV, Edelstein CL, Walker RJ, Endre ZH. Some biomarkers of acute kidney injury are increased in pre-renal acute injury. Kidney Int. 2012 Jun;81(12):1254-62. doi: 10.1038/ki.2012.23. Epub 2012 Mar 14.
Sirota JC, Klawitter J, Edelstein CL. Biomarkers of acute kidney injury. J Toxicol. 2011;2011:328120. doi: 10.1155/2011/328120. Epub 2011 Oct 29.

Mehta RL, Kellum JA, Shah SV, Molitoris BA, Ronco C, Warnock DG, Levin A; Acute Kidney Injury Network. Acute Kidney Injury Network: report of an initiative to improve outcomes in acute kidney injury. Crit Care. 2007;11(2):R31.

secondary_outcome.description: renal function and need for RRT
secondary_outcome.measure: Short and long term renal outcomes

secondary_outcome.description: Association of urine chemistry and microscopy with novel biomarkers to predict AKI diagnosis and progression
secondary_outcome.measure: Association of urine chemistry and microscopy  to predict acute kidney injury
